Package com.jummania

Interface DataManager

public interface DataManager
Interface for managing data operations such as saving, retrieving, and deleting key-value data, including support for JSON serialization, pagination, and list management.

Implementations of this interface should provide persistent or in-memory storage functionality.

Created by Jummania on 20, November 2024. Email: sharifuddinjumman@gmail.com Dhaka, Bangladesh.

  • Method Details

    • saveObject

      void saveObject (String key, Object value, Type typeOfSrc)
      Saves an object to the storage system associated with the given key, using the specified type.

      This is useful for objects with generic types or when the runtime class does not fully capture the type information. Implementations should serialize the object using typeOfSrc.

      Parameters:
      key - the unique key identifying the storage location; must not be null
      value - the object to save; may be null to remove the key
      typeOfSrc - the Type representing the object's type for serialization
      See Also:
      • saveObject(String, Object)

    • saveObject

      default void saveObject (String key, Object value)
      Saves an object to the storage system associated with the given key.

      This is a convenience method equivalent to calling saveObject(String, Object, Type) using the object's runtime class.

      Parameters:
      key - the unique key identifying the storage location; must not be null
      value - the object to save; may be null to remove the key
      See Also:
      • saveObject(String, Object, Type)

    • getObject

      <T> T getObject (String key, Type type)
      Retrieves an object of the specified type associated with the given key. The object is deserialized from the underlying data source to match the specified type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to be returned
      Parameters:
      key - the key to look up the object
      type - the type of the object to be returned
      Returns:
      the object of the specified type associated with the key, or null if not found or if the type doesn't match

    • getRawString

      String getRawString (String key)
      Retrieves the raw String value associated with the given key. The value is returned as-is, without any defaulting behavior.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to look up the value
      Returns:
      the raw String value associated with the key, or null if not found

    • saveInt

      default void saveInt (String key, int value)
      Saves an integer value associated with the given key by converting the integer to a string. If the key already exists, the value will be updated.

      This is a shorthand method that calls saveObject(String, Object) by converting the integer value to a string.

      Parameters:
      key - the key to associate with the integer value
      value - the integer value to save

    • saveLong

      This is a shorthand method that calls saveObject(String, Object) by converting the long value to a string.

      Parameters:
      key - the key to associate with the long value
      value - the long value to save

      Retrieves a string value associated with the given key. If no value is found or the value is null, returns the provided default value.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to look up the value
      defValue - the default value to return if no value is found or if the result is null
      Returns:
      the retrieved string value or the default value if not found

      default String getString (String key)

      This is a shorthand method that calls getString(String, String) with a default value of null.

      Parameters:
      key - the key to look up the value
      Returns:
      the retrieved string value or null if not found

      default boolean getBoolean (String key)

      Parameters:
      key - the key to look up the value
      Returns:
      the retrieved boolean value or false if not found

    • getFullList

      <E> List<E> getFullList (String key, Class<E> eClass, boolean reverse)
      Retrieves the complete list of elements stored under the specified key by combining all paginated data segments into a single List.

      The list data is divided into pages (e.g., key.1, key.2, etc.), and this method reconstructs the full list by reading and concatenating all pages. If reverse is true, pages are read in reverse order (from last to first).

      If the key has no metadata or no valid pages, an empty list is returned.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      key - the base key used to identify the stored paginated list
      eClass - the class type of the list elements (used for deserialization)
      reverse - true to load pages in reverse order (from last to first); false to load them in natural order
      Returns:
      a List containing all elements across all stored pages, or an empty list if no data is found

    • getFullList

      default <E> List<E> getFullList (String key, Class<E> eClass)
      Retrieves the complete list of elements stored under the specified key in natural (forward) order.

      This is a convenience overload of getFullList(String, Class, boolean) with reverse set to false.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      key - the base key used to identify the stored paginated list
      eClass - the class type of the list elements (used for deserialization)
      Returns:
      a List containing all elements across all stored pages, or an empty list if no data is found
      See Also:
      • getFullList(String, Class, boolean)

    • getPagedList

      <E> PaginatedData<E> getPagedList (String key, Class<E> eClass, int page, boolean reverse)
      Retrieves a paginated list of elements associated with the specified key.

      This method allows fetching a specific page of data from storage. Pages are 1-based. If reverse is true, pages are counted from the last page backward (e.g., 1 last page, 2 second-to-last, etc.).

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      key - the unique key identifying the dataset
      eClass - the class type of the list elements (for deserialization)
      page - the page number to retrieve (1-based)
      reverse - if true, pages are fetched in reverse order
      Returns:
      a PaginatedData object containing the elements for the requested page
      See Also:
      • PaginatedData
      • Pagination

    • getPagedList

      default <E> PaginatedData<E> getPagedList (String key, Class<E> eClass, int page)
      Retrieves a paginated list of elements associated with the specified key.

      This is a convenience method equivalent to calling getPagedList(String, Class, int, boolean) with reverse = false.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      key - the unique key identifying the dataset
      eClass - the class type of the list elements (for deserialization)
      page - the page number to retrieve (1-based)
      Returns:
      a PaginatedData object containing the elements for the requested page
      See Also:
      • getPagedList(String, Class, int, boolean)

    • saveList

      <E> void saveList (String key, List<E> list, int listSizeLimit, int maxBatchSize)
      Saves a list of elements to storage, splitting it into batches if necessary.

      The list is divided into smaller sublists (batches) according to maxBatchSize, and each batch is stored separately. Metadata about the total items, total pages, and batch size is stored under a special key.meta entry.

      If the list is null or becomes empty after applying listSizeLimit, the key is removed from storage.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      key - the unique key identifying the dataset
      list - the list of elements to save; may be null
      listSizeLimit - the maximum total number of elements to store
      maxBatchSize - the maximum number of elements per batch (must be 1)
      See Also:
      • saveObject(String, Object, Type)
      • remove(String)
      • MetaData.toMeta(int, int, int)

    • saveList

      default <E> void saveList (String key, List<E> list)
      Saves a list of objects associated with the given key by converting the list to a JSON string. If the key already exists, the list will be updated. The size of the list is capped to 25 elements.

      This is a shorthand method that calls saveList(String, List, int, int) with a default maximum array size of 25.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      key - the key to associate with the list of objects
      list - the list of objects to save

    • appendToList

      <E> void appendToList (String key, E element, Class<E> eClass, int listSizeLimit, int maxBatchSize, boolean addFirst, Predicate<? super E> preventDuplication)
      Appends a single element to a paginated list stored under the given key.

      If the list does not exist, a new one is created. The list is stored in batches according to maxBatchSize, and the total number of elements is limited by listSizeLimit. Optionally, an existing element can be removed before adding the new element using the itemToRemove predicate.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      key - the unique key identifying the stored paginated list
      element - the element to append; ignored if null
      eClass - the class type of the list elements (for deserialization)
      listSizeLimit - the maximum total number of elements allowed in storage
      maxBatchSize - the maximum number of elements per batch
      addFirst - if true, the new element is added to the beginning of the list
      preventDuplication - a predicate to identify and remove an existing element; may be null
      See Also:
      • saveList(String, List, int, int)
      • saveObject(String, Object, Type)

    • appendToList

      default <E> void appendToList (String key, E element, Class<E> eClass)
      Appends a single element to a paginated list with default limits.

      This convenience method uses a default listSizeLimit of Integer.MAX_VALUE, a maxBatchSize of 25, and does not remove any existing element.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      key - the unique key identifying the stored paginated list
      element - the element to append; ignored if null
      eClass - the class type of the list elements (for deserialization)
      See Also:
      • appendToList(String, Object, Class, int, int, boolean, Predicate)

    • removeFromList

      <E> boolean removeFromList (String key, Class<E> eClass, Predicate<? super E> itemToRemove)
      Removes the first element from a paginated list stored under the given key that matches the provided predicate.

      The method searches through the list pages in reverse order (from last page to first page). If an element matching itemToRemove is found, it is removed, and the updated page and metadata are saved.

      If no matching element is found or the predicate is null, the method returns false.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      key - the unique key identifying the paginated list
      eClass - the class type of the list elements (for deserialization)
      itemToRemove - the predicate used to identify the element to remove; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if an element was found and removed; false otherwise

    • fromJson

      <T> T fromJson (String value, Class<T> tClass)
      Converts a JSON string into an object of the specified type. This method deserializes the given JSON string into an instance of the provided type using the Gson library (or similar).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to return
      Parameters:
      value - the JSON string to deserialize
      tClass - the Type of the object to convert the JSON string into
      Returns:
      the deserialized object of the specified type

    • fromReader

      <T> T fromReader (Reader json, Type typeOfT)
      Converts a JSON input stream (Reader) into an object of the specified type. This method deserializes the provided JSON from the given reader into an instance of the provided type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to return
      Parameters:
      json - the Reader that contains the JSON data to deserialize
      typeOfT - the Type of the object to convert the JSON data into
      Returns:
      the deserialized object of the specified type

    • toJson

      String toJson (Object object)
      Converts an object into its JSON string representation. This method serializes the given object into a JSON string using a serialization library such as Gson.
      Parameters:
      object - the object to serialize into JSON
      Returns:
      the JSON string representation of the object

    • toJson

      void toJson (Object src, Type typeOfSrc, Appendable writer)
      Serializes the given object into JSON using the specified type and writes it to the provided Appendable.

      This is useful when the object type includes generics or is not fully captured by its runtime class. The method allows streaming the JSON output directly to a Writer, StringBuilder, or any other Appendable.

      Parameters:
      src - the source object to serialize; must not be null
      typeOfSrc - the specific Type of the object to serialize
      writer - the destination Appendable to write the JSON output to

    • getParameterized

      Type getParameterized (Type rawType, Type... typeArguments)
      Creates a parameterized Type using the specified raw type and type arguments. This method is useful when dealing with generic types and allows the creation of a Type that can represent a generic type with its actual type parameters.
      Parameters:
      rawType - the raw type of the generic type (e.g., List)
      typeArguments - the type arguments that the generic type should use (e.g., String)
      Returns:
      the parameterized type representing the raw type with the provided type arguments

    • remove

      void remove (String key)
      Removes all data associated with the specified key, including all paginated files and the metadata file. After removal, notifies the registered data observer (if any) about the change.

      The method works as follows:

      1. Iterates through all paginated files with keys in the format key.1, key.2, ... and deletes them.
      2. Deletes the metadata file stored under key.meta.
      3. Deletes the base file associated with key.
      4. If a DataManager.DataObserver is registered, calls onDataChange(key) to notify about the deletion.
      Parameters:
      key - the base key of the data to be removed

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears all entries from the data structure. After calling this method, the data structure will be empty.

    • contains

      boolean contains (String key)
      Checks if the data structure contains an entry associated with the given key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to check for existence in the data structure
      Returns:
      true if the key exists in the data structure, false otherwise

    • addDataObserver

      void addDataObserver (DataManager.DataObserver observer)
      Registers a DataManager.DataObserver to listen for data changes.
      Parameters:
      observer - The observer to be registered.

    • removeDataObserver

      void removeDataObserver()
      Unregisters the currently registered DataManager.DataObserver.
